<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[95, 418, 225, 434]]<|/det|>
## INSTRUCTIONS  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[95, 435, 875, 632]]<|/det|>
INSTRUCTIONS- Answer all questions.- Use a black or dark blue pen. You may use an HB pencil for any diagrams or graphs.- Write your name, centre number and candidate number in the boxes at the top of the page.- Write your answer to each question in the space provided.- Do not use an erasable pen or correction fluid.- Do not write on any bar codes.- If additional space is needed, you should use the lined page at the end of this booklet; the question number or numbers must be clearly shown.- You should use a calculator where appropriate.- You must show all necessary working clearly; no marks will be given for unsupported answers from a calculator.- Give non-exact numerical answers correct to 3 significant figures, or 1 decimal place for angles in degrees, unless a different level of accuracy is specified in the question.  

<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[95, 664, 216, 679]]<|/det|>
## INFORMATION  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[95, 680, 732, 712]]<|/det|>
INFORMATION- The total mark for this paper is 50.- The number of marks for each question or part question is shown in brackets [ ].

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 73, 96, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>1</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 73, 296, 92]]<|/det|>
When the polynomial

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[418, 94, 579, 113]]<|/det|>
\[ax^{3} + 4ax^{2} - 7x - 5\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 119, 450, 138]]<|/det|>
is divided by \((x + 2)\), the remainder is 33.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 149, 376, 168]]<|/det|>
Find the value of the constant \(a\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 149, 920, 168]]<|/det|>
<mark>[2]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 75, 94, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>3</label>

<|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[416, 88, 611, 316]]<|/det|>


<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 330, 920, 380]]<|/det|>
The diagram shows the curve with equation \(y = 6\mathrm{e}^{-\frac{1}{2}x}\). The points on the curve with \(x\)-coordinates 0 and 2 are denoted by \(A\) and \(B\) respectively. The shaded region is enclosed by the curve, the line through \(A\) parallel to the \(x\)-axis and the line through \(B\) parallel to the \(y\)-axis.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 393, 146, 411]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 393, 485, 411]]<|/det|>
Find the exact gradient of the curve at \(B\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 393, 920, 411]]<|/det|>
<mark>[2]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 73, 148, 91]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 73, 484, 91]]<|/det|>
Find the exact area of the shaded region.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 73, 920, 92]]<|/det|>
<mark>[3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 73, 96, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>4</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 73, 148, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 73, 712, 92]]<|/det|>
Sketch, on the same diagram, the graphs of \(y = |3 - x|\) and \(y = 9 - 2x\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 73, 920, 92]]<|/det|>
<mark>[2]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 400, 146, 419]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 400, 450, 419]]<|/det|>
Solve the inequality \(|3 - x| > 9 - 2x\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 400, 920, 419]]<|/det|>
<mark>[3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 612, 144, 631]]<|/det|>
<label>(c)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 612, 920, 647]]<|/det|>
Use logarithms to solve the inequality \(2^{3x - 10} < 500\). Give your answer in the form \(x < a\), where the value of \(a\) is given correct to 3 significant figures.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 625, 920, 644]]<|/det|>
<mark>[3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[111, 836, 144, 855]]<|/det|>
<label>(d)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 836, 836, 855]]<|/det|>
List the integers that satisfy both of the inequalities \(|3 - x| > 9 - 2x\) and \(2^{3x - 10} < 500\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 836, 920, 855]]<|/det|>
<mark>[1]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[76, 73, 96, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>5</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 73, 146, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 73, 920, 108]]<|/det|>
Find the quotient when \(6x^{3} - 5x^{2} - 24x - 4\) is divided by \((2x + 1)\), and show that the remainder is 6.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 87, 920, 106]]<|/det|>
<mark>[3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 73, 148, 91]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 73, 250, 91]]<|/det|>
Hence find

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[391, 92, 611, 139]]<|/det|>
\[\int_{2}^{7}\frac{6x^{3} - 5x^{2} - 24x - 4}{2x + 1}\mathrm{d}x,\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 140, 695, 161]]<|/det|>
giving your answer in the form \(a + \ln b\), where \(a\) and \(b\) are integers.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 141, 920, 160]]<|/det|>
<mark>[5]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 74, 148, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 73, 670, 92]]<|/det|>
Show that the value of the parameter \(t\) at \(B\) satisfies the equation

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[430, 100, 566, 129]]<|/det|>
\[t = \frac{9}{1 + \ln t} +\frac{3}{2}.\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 106, 918, 125]]<|/det|>
<mark>[2]

<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 73, 531, 92]]<|/det|>
Prove that \(\sin 2x(\cot x + 3\tan x) \equiv 4 - 2\cos 2x.\)

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 73, 920, 92]]<|/det|>
<mark>[4]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 643, 185, 662]]<|/det|>
